title: The Portrait of a Lady - narrators remark

content.prompt: In context, the narrator’s remark in the sixteenth sentence (“she apparently took pains to convince him that she had adopted the right system”) hints that Mrs. Touchett

choices.label: is anxious to make amends for any embarrassment she has caused her husband
tends to dwell on what other people think about her unconventional marriage
misses her husband’s company more than she is prepared to acknowledge
does not make herself particularly agreeable during her visits to her husband’s house

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Describe how textual details reveal nuances and complexities in characters' relationships with one another.
